page.title: 19CHURCHES AND RELIGION
page.content: Religion has always played an important part in the lives of the villagers of Stockton on Forest, Warthill and Holtby. In the Domesday Book of 1086 Count Alan held three caractures of waste land in Stochetun whilst three more caractures belonged to the Canons of St.Peter(The church on the site of present day York Minster). In the reign of King Henry ll the Manor of Holtby had to pay an annual pension of 25 shillings to the Prior of Durham. Each of these three villages has had churches or chapels since those days,but all the existing buildings are relatively recent. Holy Trinity at Stockton dates only from 1895.St. Mary's, Warthill dates from 1873 and Holtby church was rebuilt in 1881.
